text:
The following line in "ant":

  cd `dirname "$PRG"`

is wrong - the argument to cd needs to be quoted. One possible solution:

  dirname_prg=`dirname "$PRG"`
  cd "$dirname_prg"
creator: scott_howlett@yahoo.com
florian.ramillien@laposte.net
text:
The following lines in 'ant.bat' are wrong :

if exist "%JAVA_HOME%\lib\tools.jar" call "%ANT_HOME%\bin\lcp.bat"
"%JAVA_HOME%\lib\tools.jar"
if exist "%JAVA_HOME%\lib\classes.zip" call "%ANT_HOME%\bin\lcp.bat"
"%JAVA_HOME%\lib\classes.zip"

Last argument of 'lcp.bat' must not be quoted. 'lcp.bat' handle correctly
argument without quote :

if exist "%JAVA_HOME%\lib\tools.jar" call "%ANT_HOME%\bin\lcp.bat"
%JAVA_HOME%\lib\tools.jar
if exist "%JAVA_HOME%\lib\classes.zip" call "%ANT_HOME%\bin\lcp.bat"
%JAVA_HOME%\lib\classes.zip

creator: conor@apache.org
text:
For Florian:

Please raise separate bugs for separate issues. The shell script ant and the
batch file ant.bat are very different beasts. YOur particular issue has been
addressed in CVS for 1.5.2. BTW, it is not true that lcp.bat handles unquoted
arguments. If such arguments contain spaces, lcp.bat will break them into pieces
which is not correct.
